H0.text: The respiratory system protects the body by responding to the presence of a virus.

H1.text: The skeletal system protects the body by responding to the presence of a virus.

H2.text: The immune system protects the body by responding to the presence of a virus.

H3.text: The excretory system protects the body by responding to the presence of a virus.

A4.text: The immune system detects and responds to a wide variety of pathogens, such as viruses, bacteria, and parasites, as well as cancer cells and objects, such as wood splintersâ€”distinguishing them from the organism's own healthy tissue.

A5.text: If a pathogen breaches these barriers, the innate immune system provides an immediate, but non-specific response.
